usa: Normandy Landings (D-Day): The Invasion of Normandy, one of the largest amphibious military assaults in history, began in the Allied Powers broader Operation Overlord; leading to the Liberation of Paris.[202][203][204]
The G.I. Bill was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-205" class="reference">[205]</sup>
United Nations Monetary and Financial Conference: Delegates from 44 nations met to discuss a new post-WWII monetary policy.[206]
The Dumbarton Oaks Conference began, starting the first talks between world leaders on the establishment of the United Nations.[207]
U.S. presidential election, 1944: President Franklin Delano Roosevelt was reelected to a fourth term, defeating New York Governor Thomas E. Dewey.[208]

The Battle of the Bulge, Germany's final major offensive of World War II, began; being the deadliest military battle for the United States during World War II.<sup id="cite_ref-209" class="reference">[209]</sup><sup id="cite_ref-210" class="reference">[210]</sup>
india: Subhas Chandra Bose calls Mahatma Gandhi as the Father of the Nation.
australia: Cowra breakout, mass escape of Japanese prisoners of war occurs in NSW.

Japanese inflict Sandakan Death March on 2,000 Australian and British prisoners of war – only 6 survive. The single worst war crime perpetrated against Australians.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference">[6]</sup>
Australian forces battle Japanese garrisons from Borneo to Bougainville.<sup id="cite_ref-awm.gov.au_2-2" class="reference">[2]</sup>
The Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme is introduced, providing subsidised medicine to all Australians
argentina: San Juan earthquake destroys provincial capital, kills 10,000
albania: The National Liberation Movement, supplied with British weapons, gained control of southern Albania.
The Communists met to organize an Albanian government and appointed Hoxha chairman of the executive committee and supreme commander of the National Liberation Movement.
Communist forces enter central and northern Albania.
The Communists established a provisional government with Enver Hoxha as Prime Minister.
The Communists entered the capital in the wake of a German withdrawal.
The Communist provisional government adopted laws allowing state regulation of commercial enterprises and foreign and domestic trade.
